wiki.summary: This is the sixth installment in Kendrick Lamar’s ongoing ‘The Heart’ series. A staple of his career, each entry finds Kendrick waxing poetic about the state of his life at the time of its recording; usually in the lead-up to an album release. Toward the end of Kendrick’s public beef with Drake earlier in 2024, Drake released “THE HEART PART SIX,” mocking Lamar’s series after Kendrick mocked Drake’s own timestamp series with “6:16 In LA. wiki.content: This is the sixth installment in Kendrick Lamar’s ongoing ‘The Heart’ series. A staple of his career, each entry finds Kendrick waxing poetic about the state of his life at the time of its recording; usually in the lead-up to an album release. Toward the end of Kendrick’s public beef with Drake earlier in 2024, Drake released “THE HEART PART SIX,” mocking Lamar’s series after Kendrick mocked Drake’s own timestamp series with “6:16 In LA.” Shortly thereafter, Drake would delete his Instagram post promoting this song. Along with the tone of the piece itself, many interpreted this move as Drake silently accepting defeat. This track is Kendrick’s attempt at reclaiming his series. The formatting of “The Heart” series has always been “The Heart Pt. __” while this track dropped the word “The” and has been stylized all in lowercase letters, this might’ve been done to avoid any confusion with Drake’s version. Although some might expect Kendrick to address the rap battle on this track, he does not make any reference to the beef and commits to his original idea for the series: expressing his thoughts on the culture at large as well as his personal life. In this case, he focuses on his early years in the industry and his eventual departure from Top Dawg Entertainment and Black Hippy. Read more on Last.fm.
